questions.clue: This Spanish festival involves running in front of a group of bulls through the streets of Pamplona.

This famous physicist developed the theory of relativity, which laid the foundation for quantum mechanics.
In quantum mechanics, this term describes the smallest possible discrete unit of any physical property.
This principle states that certain pairs of physical properties cannot be known simultaneously with high precision.
In quantum mechanics, this is the term for the phenomenon where particles can exist in multiple states at once until observed.
This concept describes the ability of particles to instantaneously affect each other's state, even when separated by large distances.
This herb, often used in Italian cuisine, is essential for making pesto sauce.

questions.clue: This Herman Melville novel opens with the simple line, 'Call me Ishmael.'
This epic Russian novel by Leo Tolstoy begins with, 'All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.'
The opening line of this novel by George Orwell is, 'It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.'

This novel by Gabriel García Márquez starts with the line, 'Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano Buendía was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice.'
questions.answer: What is 'One Hundred Years of Solitude'?
